titleStmt.title: [Receipt] 1815 Nov. 1 [to] Return J. Meigs / The Path Killer et al. : a machine readable transcription of an image
titleStmt.author: The Path Killer

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Special Collections Library, University of Tennessee, Knoxville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Special Collections Librarian, Hoskins Library, University of Tennessee, 1401 Cumberland Avenue, Knoxville, TN 37996. (865) 974-4480.

bibl.title: [Receipt] 1815 Nov. 1 [to] Return J. Meigs / The Path Killer et al
bibl.author: The Path Killer
bibl.note: This document is a receipt dated November 1, 1815, acknowledging that Return J. Meigs, acting as agent to the Cherokee Nation, paid thirty-six thousand dollars to the Cherokee for their annuities for the years 1813 through 1816.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.p:
Received of Return J Meigs Thirty Six Thousand Dollars that sum being the amount of the Cherokee annuities for the years 1813 14 15 & 16 received for the said Cherokee Nation
infull in full for the years above stated
div.closer:
Cherokee Agency
1st Novr. November 1815
The Path Killer his X mark
Richd. Richard Brown his X mark
Jno. John McIntosh his X mark
The Duck his X mark
Witness
Caleb Starr
Richard Taylor Interpreter
Ross
D
Recpt. Receipt the Cherokees for part of their annuity for the year 1817.
$30000.33 Â½ cts cents
$36000.00
November 1st. 1815
